edu.kit.scc.dem.wapsrv.service

Class AbstractWapService

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.kit.scc.dem.wapsrv.service.AbstractWapService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WapService
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AnnotationServiceImpl, ContainerServiceImpl

    public abstract class AbstractWapService
extends java.lang.Object
implements WapService
    Base implementation for WapServices that implements common behavior
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Matthias Dressel, Michael Hitzker, Markus Hoefler, Andreas Loeffler, Timo Schmidt

      • isValidInputFormat

        public boolean isValidInputFormat(Format format)
        Description copied from interface: WapService
        Checks whether a given format is valid for usage in PUT/POST requests
        Specified by:
        isValidInputFormat in interface WapService
        Parameters:
        format - The format to check for validity
        Returns:
        true if format can be used, false otherwise

      • checkSchemaValidity

        protected void checkSchemaValidity(java.lang.String rawString,
                                   Format format,
                                   FormattableObject.Type type)
        Checks input for validity according to WADM schemas. If no Exception is thrown, the annotation/container is valid.
        If globally disabled in WapServerConfig.enableValidation this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        rawString - The serialized annotation/container
        format - The format of the serialized annotation/container
        type - The type of the string, Annotation or Container
        Throws:
        InternalServerException - If validator could not be instantiated
        NotAnAnnotationException - If type annotation and invalid
        NotAContainerException - If type container and invalid

      • assertValidIds

        protected java.lang.String assertValidIds(java.lang.String jsonLdString)
        This methods asserts that only valid ids are used by replacing them if needed
        Parameters:
        jsonLdString - The source string
        Returns:
        A copy of the input using only valid ids

      • checkEtag

        public void checkEtag(java.lang.String iri,
                      java.lang.String etag)
        Check if etag of a WapObject matches. this function throws a EtagDoesntMatchException if the etag given is not identical to the one in the database.
        Parameters:
        iri - the IRI of the WapObject to check the etag
        etag - the etag should be in the database for the WapObject with the given IRI

      • deleteObject

        public void deleteObject(java.lang.String iri,
                         java.lang.String parentSeqIri)
        Delete WapObject. This function marks the WapObject as "deleted" and removes it from its parent containers annotation/subcontainer rdf:seq.
        Parameters:
        iri - the IRI of the WapObject to delete
        parentSeqIri - the parent rdf:seq IRI to remove the WapObject from

      • deleteObjectBulk

        public void deleteObjectBulk(java.util.List<java.lang.String> iriList)
        Delete WapObjects as Bulk. This function only marks every WapObject in the iriList as "deleted" but does not remove it from its parent containers annotation/subcontainer rdf:seq.
        Parameters:
        iriList - the IRI list

      • updateEtag

        public void updateEtag(org.apache.commons.rdf.api.BlankNodeOrIRI node,
                       java.lang.String generateEtag)
        Update etag and the modified Tag since any changes on a object have to update the etag this function has to adapt the modified date, too.
        Parameters:
        node - the IRI of the WapObject
        generateEtag - the new etag for the WapObject

      • updateEtag

        public void updateEtag(java.lang.String iri,
                       java.lang.String generateEtag)
        Update etag and the modified Tag since any changes on a object have to update the etag this function has to adapt the modified date, too.
        Parameters:
        iri - the IRI of the WapObject
        generateEtag - the new etag for the WapObject

      • writeWapObjectToDb

        protected void writeWapObjectToDb(WapObject wapObject)
        Write WapObject to database.
        Parameters:
        wapObject - the WapObject to be put in the database.

      • checkExistsAndNotDeleted

        public void checkExistsAndNotDeleted(java.lang.String objectIri)
        Check if the WapObject exists and has not been marked as "deleted". The function throws NotExistentException if the WapObject does not exist and it throws a ResourceDeletedException if the WapObject is marked as "deleted".
        Parameters:
        objectIri - the object IRI to be checked

      • containsIri

        public boolean containsIri(java.lang.String iri)
        Checks if the database contains the given IRI.
        Parameters:
        iri - the IRI
        Returns:
        true, if IRI in database

      • isIriDeleted

        public boolean isIriDeleted(java.lang.String iri)
        Checks if IRI is marked as "deleted".
        Parameters:
        iri - the IRI to check
        Returns:
        true, if IRI is marked as "deleted"

      • getAnnotation

        public Annotation getAnnotation(java.lang.String iri)
                         throws WapException
        Gets the Annotation. First it will be checked if the IRI exists and is not deleted.
        Specified by:
        getAnnotation in interface WapService
        Parameters:
        iri - the IRI for the Annotation
        Returns:
        the requested annotation
        Throws:
        WapException - the Exceptions from @see #checkExistsAndNotDeleted(String)
